title: Eddie Murphy reveals plans to make Beverly Hills Cop 4 after Coming To America sequel
text:
Eddie Murphy is taking a 'back to the future' approach for his next several projects.

The actor-comedian revealed he's going to reprise his role of Axel Foley for Beverly Hills Cop 4 after he finishes the sequel to Coming To America.

'Yeah that's what we're doing after Coming to America 2,' he said during an interview with Collider.

'We're doing Beverly Hills Cop and then the plan is to get back on stage and do stand-up,' he told the publication.

Back to the future approach: Eddie Murphy announced he will make Beverly Hills Cop 4 after the Coming To America sequel

The 58-years-old made the big announcements while out promoting his latest film, Dolemite Is My Name, a biopic comedy about comic Rudy Ray Moore, which opens in theaters October 4 and then streams on Netflix beginning on October 25.

The Beverly Hills franchise has been dormant since the third installment hit theaters in 1994.

The original 1984 film was a bona fide hit in the US, raking in more than $234 million dollars, making it the highest grossing film of that year.

Beverly Hills Cop II was also a smash at the box office three years later, grossing more than $153 million domestically, while matching the original's $300 million take worldwide.

Iconic: Murphy became a huge film star with the success of the original Beverly Hills Cop film in 1984; he is pictured as Axl Foley in the wildly successful action-comedy

It's been 31 years since Murphy played Prince Akeem, the prince of Zamunda in 1988's Coming To America. It was also a commercial success, earning more than $288 million worldwide.

Murphy's reprisal of two of his most iconic characters likely won't end there.

Just weeks ago it was announced that he would be the guest host for Saturday Night Live's Christmas episode on December 21.

1980's hit-maker: It's been 31 years since Murphy played Prince Akeem, the prince of Zamunda in 1988's Coming To America

This will be Murphy's first time back on the SNL stage since he left the sketch show back in 1984 after five seasons.

His iconic characters and impressions has been credited with being an integral part of what kept SNL on the air in the early 1980s when many critics and fans believed the show had lost its way creatively.

Some of his hugely popular characters included Buckwheat, Gumby and Mr. Robinson, and he also wowed audiences with his impressions of James Brown, Bill Cosby, Stevie Wonder and Sammy Davis Jr, to name a few.

Murphy is also widely recognized as one of the greatest stand-up comedians of all time.
description: Eddie Murphy revealed he will make Beverly Hills Cop 4 after Coming To America sequel and return to Saturday Night Live as a guest host, in an interview with Collider.
